name: JavaScript 3/5
description: JavaScript 3/5 is the "old" version of JavaScript as currently supported by browsers (mostly JavaScript 5). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaScript. Good to be used directly on small projects where build tools  and transpiling are overhead. We prefer the use of ES2015 and beyond and use Babel for transpiling so more modern an powerful JavaScript language features can be used. SXA

name: ES2015+
description: The new version of JavaScript with way more powerful language constructs. See http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/6.0/ for the language specification. Not all browser support the new ES2015 features, so use Babel - https://babeljs.io/ - for transpiling. This means that the project requires a build system. https://babeljs.io/learn-es2015/ gives nice overview of the new ES2015 features. TypeScript (as a better ES2015+ - needs transpiling anyway)

name: jQuery
description: Still a viable solution for small projects, and for example in combination with Bootstrap and SiteCore SXA.

name: SASS
description: Is used for all transpiled "CSS" styling, if not css in js used.

name: Bootstrap
description: Still the #1 library for web UI's, especially for administrative screens.

name: Typescript
description: Use latest version where possible, use strict mode where possible (required by Create React App)

name: Jest
description: Testing library to describe your test.

name: SVG
description: Scalable Vector Graphics - the solution for resolution independent graphics.

name: ReactJS
description: Our current choice as view library.

name: Angular
description: Full-fledged framework for line-of-business SPA applications.

name: Webpack
description: The coordinator behind transpilation, minification and obfuscation. Client-side bundles CRA2 where possible,  server-side bundles custom webpack configuration.

name: VueJS
description: Used in some of the Macaw projects. Not our default starting point, but a viable alternative.

name: D3.js
description: The library for advanced data visualization and animation.

name: Web Components
description: We love the idea, nut the technology did not prove itself enough yet. Still different implementations of the standard. TODO.

name: jQuery
description: on't start another project with jQuery, in some cases needed.

name: JavaScript 3/5
description: Only if very simple, no transpiling.

name: Solr
description: Part of the Sitecore box, use it for internal purposes, for custom search adopt ElasticSearch, AzureSearch

name: Sitecore SXA
description: Prefered platform for out of the box Sitecore implementations

name: Sitecore JSS
description: To use Sitecore as a headless CMS

name: Docker / containers
description: For unit of deployment, linux, Azure Web Apps / kubernetes

name: Full Stack devs
description: Don't be scared of install complete platform and edit Razor views

name: Yarn
description: npm/yarn move in same pace - make a choice --> npm
